p: The receptor-binding domain (RBD) of the heavily glycosylated S protein of SARS-CoV-2 interacts with the angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) receptor and attaches to the surface of the host cells leading to receptor-mediated endocytosis of the virion [ 9]. The viral envelope fuses with the endosomal membrane with the help of host proteases and releases the viral genome into the cytoplasm of the host cell [ 10]. The virus generally binds with ACE2 receptors in the lungs and intestinal tract, replicates further, resulting in severe consequences. More than 10% of patients without acute infection experienced diarrhoea and nausea within 1–2 days before the advancement of disease and development of any critical symptoms, including fever and respiratory illness [ 11– 13]. Subsequently, it put forward the possibility of the virus load along with faecal matter either in an active or infective state.
